nodes.description: 2017年5月22日22:31，曼彻斯特体育馆发生爆炸，22人死亡
nodes.support_text: Fire crews desperate to help victims of the Manchester Arena bombing were held back by their bosses for two hours amid mistakes that brought the service ‘to the brink of failure’.

nodes.description: 爆炸后10分钟内，警察和急救人员抵达现场，但消防部门因内部延误未能及时响应
nodes.support_text: While paramedics and armed police were on the scene of last May’s attack within ten minutes, the fire service was in ‘paralysis’.

nodes.description: 消防指挥官彼得·奥利里因未参与联合指挥中心且未及时传达信息，导致救援延迟近两小时
nodes.support_text: Lord Kerslake’s review concludes the actions of then-chief officer Peter O’Reilly ‘played a key role’ in the delays.

nodes.description: Vodafone紧急热线因服务器故障完全瘫痪，迫使家属自行寻找医院获取信息
nodes.support_text: Vodafone, which holds the national Home Office contract for emergency post-disaster hotlines, experienced a ‘catastrophic’ technical failure on the night that meant no fully-functioning phone number could be set up for desperate people in search of information.

nodes.support_text: The people of Manchester did a fantastic job of boosting the morale of those affected.
